page.title: 04WOOTTON'S VILLAGE POLICEMAN
page.content: Wootton's community policeman rides his motorbicycle around his area for 8 hours a day. He is the only policeman in Wootton and when he is off duty Wootton is patrolled by Ryde police force. He works mainly in the village but sometimes has to attend football matches on the mainland. Most of the time he is concerned with routine chores such as checking the firearms of local farmers and making sure there is no trouble at pubs. Sometimes he has to investigate the thefts of boats and equipment. Burglary from boats is the main problem in Wootton because often it is not discovered until the owner wants to use the boat again. He has little trouble from tourists apart from the occasional gangs of youths causing trouble.
